newsitem.title: JAMAICA: Jamaica orders arrest of singer Sade.
newsitem.headline: Jamaica orders arrest of singer Sade.

text.p: A Jamaican court has ordered the arrest of popular singer Sade if she returns to the island.
The warrant was issued when the singer failed to appear in court on Monday to face charges of dangerous driving.

The Nigerian-born Sade, whose real name is Helen Folasade, failed to appear in court on June 25. When the case was recalled on Monday, she had a new attorney who explained she was in London caring for her sick daughter.

But the judge said there was nothing to indicate from the report provided by a London hospital when her daughter was admitted or underwent surgery for a dog bite, and he was not satisfied the singer was unable to attend court on June 25.

The singer, famous for jazz-tinged ballads such as "Smooth Operator", was charged on Feb.27 in Montego Bay after she failed to obey a policeman's stop order. Another officer gave chase and she was arrested and released on J$5,000 (US$140) bail.
Sade has lived in the Ocho Rios area since last year.
